description: Single Storey rear extension with an overall depth of 3.90m, a maximum height of 2.64m, and an eaves height of 2.44m. (PRIOR APPROVAL)
decision_conditions: The proposal is not permitted development due to the cumulative width of the proposed rear extension and existing garage being more than half the width of the original dwelling (where there is a staggered original rear wall or where the proposal extends beyond the rear wall).

The proposal is not permitted development due to the cumulative depth of the proposed rear extension and the existing garage being more than 6m in depth and therefore not complying with Schedule 2 Part 1 Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015.

This written notice indicates that the proposed development would not comply with condition A.4 of Schedule 2 Part 1 Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015.  It is important to note that this written notice does not indicate whether or not the proposed development would comply with any of the other limitations of conditions of Schedule 2 Part 1 Class A.
The applicant has the right to an appeal against this notice to the Planning Inspectorate, see details below.

The guidance set outlined Permitted development rights for householder technical guidance issued by MHCLG in September 2019 states the "eaves height is measured from the ground level at the base of the outside wall to the point where that wall would meet the upper surface of the flat roof - the overhang and the parapet wall should be ignored for the purposes of measurement" for a flat roof rear extension, which means that the eaves height is measured to the top of the flat roof and therefore the eaves and overall height of a flat roof are the same, unless a roof light/lantern is added.
